summary: The James Webb Space Telescope—NASA’s planned successor to the Hubble telescope—is on track to make its launch date in October 2018 and stay within its $8.8 billion budget. Most of the major project components have been delivered, and are now being integrated and tested. JWST currently has 6 months of extra time set aside in its schedule to address any issues that might arise during...
title: James Webb Space Telescope: Project Meeting Cost and Schedule Commitments but Continues to Use Reserves to Address Challenges
